intro: Ilex casiquiarensis, commonly known as the Casiquiarensis holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America, specifically Colombia and Venezuela. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its spiny leaves and small, dark berries. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species. Its ornamental value has also led to its cultivation in some botanical gardens.
